Tokens.innerText: This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.
Tokens.text: **This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.**

tokens.text: This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.

Tokens.text: 1. Combine all the ingredients and mix and knead — by hand, mixer, or bread machine — to make a soft, smooth dough; about 15 to 20 minutes by hand, 7 to 10 minutes in a mixer, and 20 to 30 minutes in a bread machine.
2. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl and let it rise for 45 to 60 minutes, until puffy but not necessarily doubled in bulk.
3. Lightly grease a 9" x 5" loaf pan.

4. On a lightly greased work surface, gently deflate the dough, and form it into a 9" log. Place the log in the prepared pan, cover, and let it rise for 60 to 90 minutes, until it crests about 1" over the rim of the pan.
6. Bake the bread for 40 to 50 minutes, until it's light gold and a digital thermometer inserted into the center reads 190°F.
7. Remove the bread from the oven, and after a couple of minutes turn it out of the pan onto a rack to cool. Store, well-wrapped, at room temperature for several days; freeze for longer storage.
You come back to check on your bread after the alarm you set sounds.

After some time your loaf of bread is done.

Tokens.text: You preheat your oven, then you add your dough and let your loaf cook.
After 40 minutes you come back to check on your bread.
You see that the dough is completly black.

You take the tray out but you forgot to grab the mittens to protect your hands. You drop the tray. The tray falls against the curtains and they are set on fire. You do not own a fire extinguisher so you freak out. The neighbours sees the smoke and call the firefighters.

Since you decided to leave the bread in the oven, it caught fire and therefore your oven caught fire. You do not own a fire extinguisher so you freak out. The neighbours sees the smoke and call the firefighters.

Tokens.innerText: This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.
Tokens.text: **This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.**

tokens.text: This is the recepie to make this type of bread, but there is some things wrong. Find the issues with the recepie.

Tokens.text: 2. Dissolve the yeast in the warm water.
3. In a large bowl, combine the raisins, butter, sugar, salt, and warm milk; stir to dissolve the sugar. Let the mixture cool to lukewarm.
4. Stir 1 1/2 cups of the flour into the milk mixture and beat until smooth.
5. Add the yeast mixture and the beaten eggs to the milk mixture and mix to blend well.
6. Add enough of the remaining flour to make a soft but stiff dough.
7. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes, or until the dough is smooth and elastic.
8. Butter or oil a large bowl. Place the dough in the greased bowl. Turn it over to grease the entire surface of the dough.
9. Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and let it stand in a warm, draft-free place until it has doubled in bulk, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
10. Punch the dough down and divide it into two equal portions. Cover the dough with a kitchen towel and let it rest for 10 minutes.
11. Shape the dough into two loaves and place them in two greased 8-by-4-inch loaf pans.
12. Cover the pans with a kitchen towel and let the loaves rise for about 45 to 60 minutes, or until the dough has almost doubled in bulk.
for 25 minutes. Place foil over the loaves for the last 10 minutes if they look overly brown.
14. Remove the loaves from the pans and let them cool on racks.

Tokens.text: Since you ignored the fact that you are allergic to wheat and yeast you spent your last day enjoying an awsome, flavourfull and rich in wheat and yeast sandwich, deemed the best sandwich of your county.
Sadly you could not enjoy the fame that came with the creation of the best sandwich in your county since you died because of your allergic reaction.
